required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diet and Fat Mass After Traumatic Spinal Cord Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Neurogenic Obesity Following Traumatic Spinal Cord Injury

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized clinical controlled trial (RCT) to investigate the impact of a personalized nutritional intervention on functional and clinical outcomes the first year after traumatic spinal cord injury. The long term goal is to prevent gain of body fat mass and obesity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Standardized oral glucose tolerance test: intake of 75 grams glucose in a fasted state, blood glucose levels measured 2 hours post test (mmol/Liter)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring body weight in kilograms (kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Independency in activities of daily living (ADLs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Spinal Cord Independence Measure (SCIM) III will be used to assess various activities of daily living (ADLs). SCIM III comprises 19 items divided into 3 subscales (self-care, respiration and sphincter management, and mobility). The total SCIM score range from 0 to 100, with the subscales weighted as follows: self-care: scored 0-20; respiration and sphincter management: scored 0-40; and mobility: scored 0-40. Scores are higher in patients that require less assistance or fewer aids to complete basic ADLs.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scanning will be used to determine body composition by quantification of adipose tissues (visceral adipose tissue volume and abdominal subcutaneous adipose tissue volume) and muscle volumes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Bioimpedance Analysis (BIA) will be used to determine body composition by measuring total body water (TBW).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: International Spinal Cord Society QoL Basic Dataset. The QoL data set consists of 3 variables: ratings of satisfaction with general quality of life, satisfaction with physical health, and satisfaction with psychological health. All variables are rated on a Numeric Self-Rating Scale ranging from 0 (completely dissatisfied) to 10 (completely satisfied).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of albumin g/dl

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of fasting glucose (mmol/L)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of creatinine umol/L

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of Lipoprotein A1 (g/L)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of Lipoprotein B (g/L)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of folic acid (nmol/L)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of vitamin B12 pmol/L

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of ferritin ug/L

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of C-reactive protein mg/l

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of total cholesterol, high density lipoprotein (HDL) and low density lipoprotein (LDL) mmol/L

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of triglycerides mmol/L

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Blood analysis of insulin c-peptid pmol/L in a fasted state and 2 hours post oral glucose tolerance test

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of 25-hydroxy-vitamin D₃ (nmol/L)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of HbA1c mmol/mol

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cytokines: Interleukin-6 and -1, Tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Fasted blood analysis of Interleukin-6 and -1 Tumor necrosis factor-α (TNF-α) (pg/ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in isoprostanes (biomarkers of oxidative stress)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Urine analyses of isoprostanes (ng/mg) (biomarkers of oxidative stress)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiorespiratory fitness levels will be determined by measuring peak oxygen uptake (VO2peak; ml/kg/min) during maximal exercise testing on a treadmill or ergometry cycle.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline to 12 months follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Cardiorespiratory fitness levels will be determined by measuring peak oxygen uptake (VO2peak; liter/min) during maximal exercise testing on a treadmill or ergometry cycle.

arm_group.description: Dietitian led assessment and individual nutritional therapy during inpatient rehabilitation with follow-up the first year after injury
Standard treatment includes dietitian-led group session on nutrition after SCI and patient visits / consultations on request from doctor.

intervention.description: Dietitian led assessment and individual nutritional therapy during inpatient rehabilitation with follow-up the first year after injury

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Traumatic spinal cord injury
- Levels C1-L2
- American Spinal Injury Association (ASIA) Impairments Scale (AIS) A-D
Exclusion Criteria:
- Glasgow Coma Scale score (GCS) equal to or lower than 13
- Below 18 years of age
- Medical issues like impaired cognitive function, progressive disorders and co-morbidities.
